Containers.Name: binhex-delugevpn
Containers.Description: [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Description[/span][/u][/b][br] Deluge is a full-featured ​BitTorrent client for Linux, OS X, Unix and Windows. It uses ​libtorrent in its backend and features multiple user-interfaces including: GTK+, web and console. It has been designed using the client server model with a daemon process that handles all the bittorrent activity. The Deluge daemon is able to run on headless machines with the user-interfaces being able to connect remotely from any platform.[br][br] [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Configuration[/span][/u][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] This is where deluge will store it's configuration file, database and logs.[br] [b]/data[/b] This is where deluge will store data downloaded, watched folder, and archived torrents.[br][br] [b][span style='color: #E80000;']Note[/span][/b] [u]PIA users[/u][br] PIA users will need to supply VPN_USER and VPN_PASS, optionally define VPN_REMOTE (list of gateways https://www.privateinternetaccess.com/pages/client-support/#signup) if you wish to use another remote gateway other than the Netherlands.[br] [u]AirVPN users[/u][br] AirVPN users will need to generate a unique OpenVPN configuration file by using the following link https://airvpn.org/generator/[br] 1. Please select Linux and then choose the country you want to connect to[br] 2. Save the ovpn file to somewhere safe[br] 3. Start the delugevpn docker to create the folder structure[br] 4. Stop delugevpn docker and copy the saved ovpn file to the /config/openvpn/ folder on the host[br] 5. Start delugevpn docker[br] 6. Check supervisor.log to make sure you are connected to the tunnel
